title: TEREINE
content:
TEREINE was a Naiad-nymph of the river Strymon in the land of the Triballoi tribe of Thrake (north of Greece).
        She was loved by the god Ares and bore him a daughter named Thrassa.

Teirene's name meaning "She Who Pierces" from the Greek word tere√¥ meaning "to
        pierce"--a fitting name for a consort of the war-god.

Antoninus Liberalis, Metamorphoses 21 (trans. Celoria) (Greek mythographer C2nd A.D.)
          :
        "Thrassa was daughter of Ares and of Tereine daughter of Strymon."

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
